definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: Today's vegetarian generations may frown upon canned luncheon meat.
sentences.chinese: 如今素食的一代人是不喜歡罐裝的午餐肉的。

sentences.english: This brand of tinned beans contains no artificial colouring.
sentences.chinese: 這種品牌的罐裝青豆不含人造色素。

sentences.english: You can apply canned shellac with a disposible paint brush.
sentences.chinese: 你能用油漆刷子應用罐裝蟲漆。

sentences.english: Sorry, we only have canned mango juice.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，我們只有罐裝的芒果汁。

sentences.english: Don't forget canned and non-perishable pet foods.
sentences.chinese: 不要忘了罐裝或不易腐的寵物食品。

sentences.english: Thee canned goods are to be packed in cartons with double straps.
sentences.chinese: 罐裝貨物在紙箱裏，外面加兩道箍。

sentences.english: Canned foods and dry mixes will remain fresh for about 2 years.
sentences.chinese: 罐裝食物和無水處理過的食物保鮮期大概2年。

sentences.english: The early metal beverage can was made out of steel and had no pull-tab .
sentences.chinese: 早期的金屬罐裝飲料由鐵製成，也沒有拉標籤。

sentences.english: Sometimes they drink “ iced tea ” from cans, like soda.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，他們和罐裝的“冰茶”，就像蘇打一樣。

sentences.english: There was an enormous ham for baking, and canned vegetables and potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 還有一個巨大的供烘焙的火腿，罐裝蔬菜和西紅柿。

sentences.english: The canned goods are to be packed in cartons with double straps.
sentences.chinese: 罐裝貨物在紙箱裏，拖戽加兩道箍。

sentences.english: The solution was to create little pots of jellied bouillon .
sentences.chinese: 解決方法就是製造小罐裝的湯凍。

sentences.english: Rinsing canned beans before using also easesthe problem.
sentences.chinese: 在食用罐裝紅豆之前加以漂也可較好地解決該問題。

sentences.english: I like canned pineapple and peaches.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡罐裝的菠蘿和桃子。

sentences.english: We're interested in your canned goods and wish to have the catalogues.
sentences.chinese: 我們對你方罐裝食品感興趣，希望能見到目錄。

sentences.english: The roots can be used medicinally as an analgesic.
sentences.chinese: 根罐裝可藥用作爲一種止痛藥。

definition: loose goods/goods sold open/draft (of beer, as opposed to bottled)
to reconstitute (a powdered beverage) by adding water, milk etc
food preserved in sugar or honey
